website_summaries.verdict: Earns high marks for its adjustable fit and ergonomic design that comfortably accommodates both boys and girls.
pros: Easily adjusts to fit most toilet shapes and secures well without sliding or wobbling
Gentle contours improves comfort for little bottoms and encourages correct positioning
Inbuilt splash guard effectively prevents spills
Built-in handle allows for easy storage and handling
cons: No side handles for little ones to hold on to

customer_reviews.title: Best Trainer Seat
customer_reviews.text: This is the best toilet trainer seat out there. I’ve tried others, so I know. We bought two of them and I couldn’t imagine not having them. We put a command hook on the wall in the powder room so that the Baby Bjorn trainer could be stored while my daughter is not using it and so guests don’t sit on it by mistake. She knows how to pull it off of the wall and place it on the toilet. Also, it fits the toilet seat perfectly. Definitely get this trainer seat as opposed to others.
customer_reviews.author: Risse

customer_reviews.title: Love this, buy this!
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased the Oxo one that stands on its side, but my toddler wasn't too keen on it because it wobbles on our toilet seat. I really didn't realize how much it moved until one time she almost fell off the seat when she sat. Since then she has been using the smaller kid potty and refusing the adult potty. I wish I looked at trainer seats more carefully because this baby bjorn one is perfect! There is a dial that can adjust so that depending on the toilet it can widen to fit the seat snugly. I showed my daughter how the new seat didn't wobble and she was sitting again on the adult potty immediately!
customer_reviews.author: T. L.Top Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Great toilet seat!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is great! It fits our toilet perfectly, and I bought a little hook, so as to hang it on the side of the toiler when adults need to use the toilet. My son, who is just over 2 years old, can sit on this with great ease and not have to worry about falling into the toilet. It seems comfortable enough that he can sit there for long enough periods of time, which are needed, when potty training. Highly recommended, and it has become the preferred potty, as we also have a Baby Bjorn potty, which is also great, but with this, there is no mess to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Connolly

customer_reviews.title: If I could give this toilet trainer 100 stars I would
customer_reviews.text: Love how this toilet trainer actually adjusts to the size of the toilet seat, which means IT'S INCREDIBLY STURDY! And it has a good rise in the front so that no pee gets out (I have a girl and we still had pee spillage with the "Kids Toilet Training Seat By Lebogner" I had bought last year and that moves around on the toilet seat). Absolutely LOVE this toilet trainer. It's worth every penny. I'm considering buying another one and getting rid of the unsteady Lebogner one we have.
customer_reviews.author: Stephie

customer_reviews.title: Came broken
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have returned this potty seat when I had the chance. It arrived broken on the bottom adjustable dial. It still fit ok on our toilet upstairs so we decided to keep it. Now our child is going on the toilet regularly and I tried moving it downstairs to fit in a different bathroom but it won't fit. I don't want to buy another to go on the toilet downstairs, this was already an expensive item. I am giving it two stars though because where it does fit it works pretty well and is relatively easy to clean. If you receive one that works properly I think it would be a good seat.
customer_reviews.author: heavy74

customer_reviews.title: Fits my weird round toilet seat
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars for this fitting well. We have one of those weird old school round toilet seat lids and I was worried everyone was writing about it fitting the oval ones so well that this wouldn't fit mine. It does, the dial-adjustment knob turned all the way and it's great. I also like the rubber handle, easy to remove.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for all toilets!
customer_reviews.text: I love this toilet for my tiny tot! She is below the average and she fits comfortably on it. It also tightens according to your toilet’s individual size. I had bought another toilet and it turned out that it didn’t fit my toilet so this was nice to find out. The only things I would change if I could would be to make that bevel on the tip of the toilet to be a little shorter because like I said, my daughter is tiny so she can’t get off the toilet on her own because of this. I also wish it would’ve come with a cute hanging hook for it since it has the ability for it.
customer_reviews.author: snestes

customer_reviews.title: Fits every toilet I’ve tried!
customer_reviews.text: So we’re on day 6 of potty training our 20 month old and this seat was recommended in one of the Potty Training Books that I read, Oh Crap! Potty Training by Jamie Glowacki. It’s perfect! We also have a Baby Bjorn Potty chair (the little one you put on the ground) which my daughter preferred the first few days of training, but today she had 0 accidents and used this seat exclusively. It works on both our toilets at home (different models in each bathroom) and at my parents house. It fits snuggly and doesn’t move at all once on. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Richard O. Baize

customer_reviews.title: Great seat and stays put even without perfect fit!
customer_reviews.text: Love this seat! I saw this potty seat in an ebook about potty training and looked it up. The one we were using slid around very scarily so I needed a better option. Honestly, this seat doesn’t even sit right down onto our annoying toilet seats but it’s snug enough esp w the back tightening function that it doesn’t slide. Even if you think it may not fit, I think it’s worth a try! I thought wouldn’t be good but we love it and my son has been comfortable on it ever since we started.
customer_reviews.author: KristenTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Best overall toilet trainer for the main throne
customer_reviews.text: This is the best of many toilet trainer seats we've tried for learners. It it adjustable and fits snugly on the grown-up seat. The only area that needs improvement is the bump at the center, as it isn't perfect for redirecting wee and will occasionally be overshot when your little one needs to empty from both sides.
customer_reviews.author: MisterB

customer_reviews.title: Not sure why this one costs twice as much as others....
customer_reviews.text: I've seen others online that were at a lower cost. Decided to purchase this one because it came highly recommended. It's a little tall for my 18m to sit on by herself. I still have to pick her up to get over the splash guard. Also, the "tightening" feature to keep it in place on the toilet doesn't seem all that great. It'll just click if I try to tighten it in place and still moves around some.
customer_reviews.author: Sunfyre60

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for Elongated Toilets!
customer_reviews.text: The best! At first we bought a character potty seat at Target but it didn't fit, slid all over the place and was very dangerous. This one fits perfectly on my elongated toilets, no gaps on the front or on the back. Plus my son likes that it looks like a real toilet that is made just for him.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not for a boy
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it will be a good product for girls but definitely not for boys, the splash guard is very low.
customer_reviews.author: pau

customer_reviews.title: Should be recalled
customer_reviews.text: A little slip resulted in an emergency room visit with near stitches. I have several friends who indicated the same issue with this toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very hard surface, leaves mark on toddler
customer_reviews.text: Although I would agree that it is very sturdy and well made, the surface is so hard that it left red marks on my toddlers butt after he sat on it for less than 1 minute.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Toddler preferred!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried four other kinds and my kid prefers this one because it does not slide around. I have used it on three different toilets elongated and non, it fits perfectly. Nice thick plastic and large loop to hang. It does not come with a hook to hang but trust me its better quality than those that do- buy a hook and don’t sacrifice their comfort!
customer_reviews.author: Buttons

customer_reviews.title: Good potty seat, great for a dedicated bathroom
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good potty seat. It has two plastic bars that help hold it in place so it doesn't wobble. The front is tall enough to block most of the pee when my toddler aims poorly. There's a nice loop so it's easy to hang. However, it's kind of a pain to remove and attach each time because you have to readjust the plastic bars so we leave it on the toilet in the kid's bathroom and ask guests to use a different restroom. You could put it on without adjusting but then the potty seat would wobble a bit, which scares my toddler.
customer_reviews.author: cabbs

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price. Perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: Had trouble with other seats not fitting right -- toilet too oval, toilet too round, seat slips around, etc. This toilet seat is adjustable! I have taken it to friends' houses for my daughter to use, and it adjusts easily to fit other toilets and then takes half a second to adjust back at home. Doesn't slip around. My daughter loved it the first time she used it. I was a bit surprised because she has the Baby Bjorn potty chairs (both) but I guess she really wanted to be on the big potty from the start! She is 19 months.
customer_reviews.author: Littlevision

customer_reviews.title: wish it could be perfect for this brand
customer_reviews.text: we have had the potty chairs of this brand and were highly recommended by a potty trainer for this product. It works for my toddler girl though it still has the small gap between the toilet seat and the potty seat as shown in the picture. No leak for my girl. However, her twin brother has quite a few accidents that the splash guard simply can't do a good job. The sitting position for the boy has to be in a certain way in order to keep everything clean; otherwise, I just have to clean up the floor as well as both seats.
customer_reviews.author: antipas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome potty seat!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve tried quite a few different potty seats but this has by far been the best one. My toddler was taken with the cheap Paw Patrol one we had but never wanted to actually use it. We’ve been giving her a choice of which one to use and she always chooses this one. Other options, she fights to not go on the potty. But she has no issues with this one. I think it’s due to the stability of it. It’s adjustable to fit the seat so it doesn’t slide around. I highly recommend it especially if you are having issues getting your little one to sit on an actual toilet!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had this in the beginning
customer_reviews.text: I started potty training my daughter over the long weekend and I ordered this per a book I read. The author raved about it, so I felt like I should get it since the other 2 I had were not sturdy enough. This is amazing! I wish I would have had this from the beginning. The only thing I wish is that it was portable so we could take it with us on outings! It is a little expensive, but so worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Tabatha B. Rush

customer_reviews.title: My favorite toilet training seat
customer_reviews.text: My favorite toilet training seat. Had one for our older boys when they were potty training, then when our third son came along more than 10 years later, I bought this again, because it just fits and is easy to clean. We've had three different standard sized toilet seats at home and this has always fit them. No silly cartoon characters, no pad to get pee in, comfortable. The guard in the front is a good size but you still have to keep an eye on your little boy to make sure they point down because it won't stop all accidental sprays. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Melanie A. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Kind of disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this. It fits my very small toilet great and I love how it adjusts. It’s easy to clean and remove. The problem is the splash guard. If you have a boy, be prepared to get pee all over your bathroom. For my son it doesn’t come up high enough. It also needs to be hollow because what little does hit it, it just splashes right back on him. Maybe this is better for a girl or a small boy. For reference my son is 23 months old, 36”, and 34 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsie Rathbone

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit all toilets, but still works great!
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t fit all toilets and ours being one of them but it still works. We only have two bathrooms and we like to be able to take it off so an adult can use the toilet so it’s fine that we can’t tighten it. It’s still sturdy enough for her to use!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: excellent on elongated toilet seats
customer_reviews.text: does not have a ladder as I wanted.... boo ! But this seat is great on elongated toilets.... You put it on, pull it forward, raise the seat and turn the dial... when it gets to almost being secure... you have to pull on the plastic to secure it in the groove.... when you finish screwing it down.... it will not move on the seat.... wonderful design..... bought a 2 step stool to go with this.
customer_reviews.author: CMW

customer_reviews.title: Works very well if you can get past the price
customer_reviews.text: Much MUCH more stable than the smaller, lighter removable seats. It has a little wheel underneath that slides a pair of grips to adjust seat to size of toilet seat opening. It doesn’t slip and pinch like the other ones. Also has a contour shape that doesn’t leave pressure marks on child’s legs. All that said, it is pricey.
customer_reviews.author: NoID99

customer_reviews.title: Potty Training :)
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this so my son can learn potty training. He was very comfortable sitting on it. It was secure and didn’t move around so he wasn’t scared he might fall. I bought the suggested hook with it and I love that it can hang. I would definitely recommend this to anyone considering buying it. 😊
customer_reviews.author: Sierra Stephens-Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Best of 3 I tried
customer_reviews.text: Have tried 3 different brands and these are the best, just got a second one since we need two now. 1) very adjustable to any toilet size so far 2) there is no suction but the least amount of pees to come out from underneath. If you have boys you wanna pay attention to this.
customer_reviews.author: Gnaz

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect seat!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect seat! We have elongated toto toilets and it fits no problem, with no gaps! I also LOVE that there is no where for the pee to collect. Those padded character seats are germ collectors and impossible to clean, so glad they are gone! The splash guard is perfect as well and haven't had any issue with my son shooting over it. Ordering a second one today for our upstairs bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: JessWing

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for trips
customer_reviews.text: Fits our Toto elongated toilet - not as designed (lever doesn't secure very well under the other toilet seat) - but it is very secure and doesn't move around. We also take this on trips, as it's small enough to fit into a bag and fits perfectly onto standard toilet seats at campground vault toilets, stores, etc. Makes potty training on trips and at home so much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Vegan Gourmet

customer_reviews.title: So I read that the baby bjorn toilet trainer fits every toilet and is easy to put on and remove
customer_reviews.text: We tried two potty's that are supposed to convert to fit on top of the toilet and they did not. So I read that the baby bjorn toilet trainer fits every toilet and is easy to put on and remove...and it IS! It has a little knob in the back that you rotate to tighten and loosen on the seat, its comfortable for my toddler to sit on and has been a much better potty training experience for her!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie L.

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Potty Trainer
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these seats on the recommendation of a potty training book (one for downstairs, one for upstairs). It was well worth the investment. It fits the toilets at our house and can be adjusted to fit the toilets at my parents' house. Our child loves to take the potty seat off the hook, position it on the toilet, and then sit on it. It's a comfortable fit for our child and, quite frankly, I tried it out too and found it quite comfortable (hey, you've got to try these things out for yourself). Highly recommend for potty training and until your child can sit on the toilet without (the fear of) falling in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice seat
customer_reviews.text: This seat serves its purpose and looks "clean" in the bathroom. I love that it has a hook to hang it on the wall when not in use. I also love that this seat uses safer products to create this seat than other brands. The only con I have is that this seat moves around on the toilet seat despite me tightening each time. The slight movement doesn't seem to affect my toddler though!
customer_reviews.author: Marley

customer_reviews.title: Nice seat, pricey for what it is!
customer_reviews.text: This seat doesn’t slip and the handle is nice. I bought it based on the Three Day Potty Training book by Brandy Brucks. She should be getting all kids of thank you gifts from Baby Bjorn. This seat is nice, but I actually like my mom’s better. It’s made by The First Years, works just as well, and was about a third of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly N.

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT fit for elongated seat!
customer_reviews.text: I bought four different seats trying to find one that would fit our elongated seat. My two year old daughter was scared if the seat slid around, so I had to find one that locked, and thank goodness I decided to spend the extra bit of money! This seat is totally worth it. We leave it on one toilet all the time, and it hasn’t budged in the week we’ve had it. My daughter is now confident to climb up and down on the toilet all by herself and is successfully in undies now!
customer_reviews.author: bmbrtz

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for potty training
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for when my little 3yr old newphew would come to stay with me for a few days. He was struggling with potty training because he was afraid he was going to fall in into the toilet. I bought this along with the little stool and it worked great!!! he was no longer afraid of falling so he was more apt to go potty in the toilet. Now he is fully potty trained and when he comes over he just puts the stool and the potty over the toilet and goes without any help. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for elongated bowl
customer_reviews.text: We have elongated toilet and it was so hard to find the one that fits and works! I tried 7 potty seats over a month but none of them worked out. This is by far the most expensive one but the only one that works for elongated. Love the simple design with a hint of neutral color and the best part is you can adjust in the back to lock it in so it won’t move around. Highly recommend it if you have elongated.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Clean, simple and effective potty seat
customer_reviews.text: The potty training book we used recommended this seat and I will say it is pretty great! I haven't tried others, but this one fits our toilet seat with just a small turn of the dial and the splash guard is a helpful feature! It doesn't slide around at all. We like that it's simple and looks fine hanging in our bathroom. I do wish it came with a toilet tank hook though.
customer_reviews.author: Cati

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS ONE
customer_reviews.text: I know its more money than a lot of the options out there but is so worth it! My little is comfy and doesn't squirm during business. I cringe at some of the styles out there, there is no way those character seats are sterile. This thing gets wiped down with Clorox just like the toilet, and it fits all the toilets I have tried. It has a little hanger on it so we bought a command strip to hand it on the wall.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it.
customer_reviews.text: This potty seat is expensive but it’s worth it. I went through FOUR other cheaper potty seats and none fit on our toilet seat without sliding around when sat on. This fits nice and snug and my daughter uses it happily. Do yourself a favor and buy this one from the start. It’s adjustable and has fit every toilet we’ve tried it on.
customer_reviews.author: Tami B.

customer_reviews.title: Not the best, but not the worst
customer_reviews.text: Has a loop for hanging which is nice, but not really in love with this as my 2yr old's urine has a tendency spray outside of the seat if she has held her urine for more than a couple of hours, like when she first wakes up in the morning. The guard in the front is of no use and so I've been teaching her to lean forward when using this seat to prevent it from happening, but it doesn't always work. Also, the dial on the seat doesn't really stay tight on our oblong seats. Lastly, the hard plastic leaves a red mark on her backside, but doesn't seem to hurt or anything, so not a showstopper.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Best Toddler Toilet Seat Around
customer_reviews.text: My 2.5 year old loves this seat! We started using this as a potty training tool right from the beginning and haven't looked back. It's easy to use, clean, and pack away for trips to various Grandparent houses. Very adjustable and we haven't encountered a toilet that it won't fit. Don't get sucked into the character designed off-brand ones - these are well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Sara S.

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you have the right toilet seat
customer_reviews.text: Before you purchase this product make sure you have the right type of toilet seat. Not sure what type that is but all three of our seat do not fit this product correctly. This is designed for an flat seat and not one where the back is raised. Because all of my toilet seats have a raised back it was not able to suction. Wished they expressed that in the description.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Baby Bjorn does it again!
customer_reviews.text: We have tried different brands of baby toilet seats and we always go back to the Baby Bjorn. It’s our toddler’s preference as well as it sits firmly on the seat and does not move around. We love it so much that we have 3 of them - one for the upstairs bathroom, one for the downstairs bathroom, and one that we pack with us and take on all vacations. Yes, we love it that much that we actually pack it in the suitcase on every single vacation - domestic and international. Do yourself a favor and buy one today!
customer_reviews.author: The GenY Consumer

customer_reviews.title: BRILLIANT DESIGN
customer_reviews.text: Literally the best potty training tool I have ever purchased. I wish so much I had had it before my 5th child! It stays in place! Fits on the but potty and has a little turning wheel that you can tighten it to the seat so it doesn’t shift everywhere. And it has the raised area preventing spray! So much more thought and design put into this than most potty seats. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Doreviews

customer_reviews.title: Seat hook coming apart
customer_reviews.text: This seat fits easily with different toilet seats and is easy to clean. However, despite being stored properly and without any rough use, the hook is coming apart from the seat. I'm upset with what is a clearly a poorly constructed item, especially one that is for young kids and should be built for durability!
customer_reviews.author: review

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't wobble!
customer_reviews.text: My son refused to use the toilet because he was afraid of falling in (he's 5). And after trying a few other seats, I decided to purchase this even tho it's a lot pricier than the other brands. The trainer fits snugly over the toilet seat and it does not move once you tighten it.
customer_reviews.author: Pandorica

customer_reviews.title: The only training potty seat I need
customer_reviews.text: I got this seat and a stand-alone training potty for my 2 year old. He will not even use the stand-alone potty he wants to use the big potty (with this seat on it) it is perfect. It comes off easily to clean and transport to Grandma's house. he's happy sitting on the big potty, and I'm happy not having to clean out a potty seat.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I just pushed the same seat different brand, which encouraged me to write this review. This seat is worth the money. I regret saving $15 and getting a cheaper version. This one stays put and is worth the money. My daughter feels comfortable sitting by herself, compared to the cheap one that moves around a lot. I would recommend this seat.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great Potty Seat!
customer_reviews.text: I did research before buying a potty seat and this was the one I decided on. It is a great seat! The adjustable part underneath is easy to use and make they seat fit any toilet seat. Its light and easy to take on and off. I highly recommend it! We got the stool to go with it and its just as great!
customer_reviews.author: britt

customer_reviews.title: The only seat that really works!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only potty seat we have found (we have looked at about 6 and tried three) that would fit the elongated toilet seat in our brand new home. A lot of the potty seat manufacturers claim that theirs will fit "any seat," but sadly they clearly have not met my super elongated behemoth! If your toilet seat cover is one of these, don't despair- this one will work!! The one star ding is because even though it claims to fit everything, my husband still had to cut a little notch out underneath so it would adjust to our seat. Not difficult. It fits securely now and none of the others would. Hurray!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So easy a 3 year old can use
customer_reviews.text: This is super easy to use. It doesn't suction to the toilet, but you can adjust it to fit most toilet seats. However, it does wiggle a bit as I don't feel it really stays 'locked' when you've turned the knob. Aside from that, my 3 year old found it really easy to train with.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Yates

customer_reviews.title: Not secure in toilet
customer_reviews.text: Item does not hold in place ...moves while my toddler is seated.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Dovalina

customer_reviews.title: Most stable seat we've used
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toilet seat for potty training. The adjustable wheel makes it nice and stable on both long and short bowl toilets. We've used a couple others at friend's houses and this is by far the most stable seat we've used. I combined it with the taller IKEA plastic step stool so his feet aren't dangling and the Ubbi toilet clip for convenient tank-side storage. I give it a good rinse after every use and it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Kate in Maine

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy and secure
customer_reviews.text: So far, no luck with potty training, but she is still very young. I do like that this is sturdy and so easy to quickly put on the toilet. It is secure and apparently comfortable. I have used others over the years and this is by far the best and most convenient.
customer_reviews.author: PZ

customer_reviews.title: I don’t see the difference
customer_reviews.text: I dont really see the difference between it and the other potty seat I bought that just fits over the toilet seat. I tightened it but it still is loose. On multiple toilets. It works and we use it, but it doesn’t stay in place any better than the other seat I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Sara P.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: I take care of my four year old grandson two days a week and needed a potty seat for him to use. The first one that I bought in a discount store was slippery on the toilet and he didn't feel secure on it. Even though the Babybjorn toilet trainer is more expensive, it is well worth it in the long run. I discarded the cheap potty seat and replaced it with the Babybjorn. He now can use the bathroom without my assistance because the seat is very secure and doesn't slip out from under him. You'll be glad you upgraded to this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen R.

customer_reviews.title: Best. Trainer. Seat.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this seat because it was recommended in a potty training book I was reading. Worth every penny. Truly, it is the perfect seat. It doesn't move when the child sits down. It is very easy to clean. My 2 year old can put the seat on the potty and hang it up when she is done because of the wide handle. Last and most favorite part, my bathroom still looks nice with it on/near the potty! Buy this seat. You won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for our son but gets loose
customer_reviews.text: This fits in our elongated toilet but it gets loose real easy. We gave up on tightening it after every use since it mostly stays in place. Otherwise, it looks comfortable for our son but I'm not sure it is worth the premium over the other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Rawlins

customer_reviews.title: The one we use the most at home
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I bought this for my son. He knows how to put it on the toilet and lock it and unlock to remove it. It's easy to clean. The shape of it is perfect for toddlers. I would recommend it to my mom friends who are potty training their kids.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: works for us
customer_reviews.text: We use it on an oblong plastic seat and the seat has a dip to it so the hidden grabbers on the potty seat cannot get a good grip and secure. Because of this, when my little guy has been sitting for awhile, sometimes the seat comes with him when he stands up. Not a big deal, just a slight annoyance. We used a different brand seat when visiting family and it was so small, virtually useless for our tall son (wears carters 5 currently). I'm glad we bought a seat that fits him, I didn't really consider that when initially purchasing!
customer_reviews.author: mike d

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: My daughter likes it. I like the back having a wheel that adjusts prongs underneath the seat. The prongs are for the inside of the toilet lid to ensure the baby’s seat doesn’t move. I recommend buying the hanging hook but hanging the seat on the door handle works too.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: The best potty
customer_reviews.text: My daughter prefers this one over other toddler toilet trainers. I like that it keeps her urine in the toilet as it has a "splash guard" type part. It had adjustable mechanism to secure to the toilet bowl in order to keep it from sliding so I appreciate that it's secure.
customer_reviews.author: Sara B.

customer_reviews.title: Not for a boy.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this toilet trainer seat, but it is not for a boy, I had read that review by a couple others but bought it anyways. It is true though, the urine goes between this trainer seat and the toilet seat and just about every time I need to lift the trainer seat and wipe both the trainer seat and the toilet seat down. I am buying a new, non-babyjorn seat today.
customer_reviews.author: fearless mum

customer_reviews.title: He likes it more than Elmo!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my nephew. Because there are multiple bathrooms in the house, this was his second trainer seat. The first one is a Sesame Street potty trainer and he loves Sesame Street. It took maybe a couple of weeks for this seat to become his favorite. He likes it more than Elmo!
customer_reviews.author: nw234

customer_reviews.title: Good but not 100% leak free
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and install but sometimes (I have a boy) there is some pee on the toilet seat because there is not enough rubber to seal it off. There is rubber on the outside of the trainer so it doesn't leak on the floor, it just stays on the toilet seat.Otherwise 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Stefaan VD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect potty seat
customer_reviews.text: Love it so much, we bought three. You have to purchase the hook as well to have a place to store the toilet when not in use. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Richard T Myers

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: Love this seat for potty training. This is the seat we have and we hang it on the side of the vanity to grab and put on the toilet. This is nice because she sits and there is no leaking. So it’s great to use early in the am or at night bc it helps her sit correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Yancey

customer_reviews.title: Not for boys
customer_reviews.text: Just like others reported, this is not very good for boys. My son does fine at keeping his urine stream down, but the pee somehow splashes under the seat in between the cracks of the regular toilet seat. If you have a girl, this seat is a better choice--it's nice and sturdy because of the adjustment mechanism. Update: I bought the P-flector after writing my initial review, and that solved the urine between the cracks problem.
customer_reviews.author: J. Veilleux

customer_reviews.title: Great quality adjustable toilet training seat
customer_reviews.text: This potty training seat fit great on our toilet. Will be very helpful as we begin the potty training process with our toddler. I can already tell out of the box that this is a good quality toilet seat.
customer_reviews.author: Soraya Katmeh

customer_reviews.title: Great potty seat!
customer_reviews.text: This potty seat seems to be very durable and sturdy. It fit just right on mummy elongated toilet seat. When my toddler sawnitnwas very excited was able to sit comfortably with no sliding. I like the front part that prevents any possible spraying.
customer_reviews.author: MrsJonesYoung

customer_reviews.title: “I can do it myself!”
customer_reviews.text: Secure experience from the beginning. We bought an extra for our granddaughter for upstairs at their house and one for our house when she comes to visit. Once established our granddaughter can easily put the seat on the toilet (when it has been removed for bigger humans) and feel great independence.
customer_reviews.author: Riptide

customer_reviews.title: Not for boys! We have a mess every time
customer_reviews.text: As several others have pointed out (and I somehow neglected to read), this seat does not work for boys. The splash guard can catch the urine, but somehow allows the actual toilet seat (both top and underside!) to get soaked. I thought it was a user error, but we've tried on multiple toilets and reinstalling it, but nothing helps. Only answer is to have our son avoid wetting on the guard at all, which defeats the purpose. 2 stars bc I expect this could work for girls and is otherwise well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Whilly

customer_reviews.title: Great transition to big potty. Fits any toilet, easy to travel with
customer_reviews.text: The adjustable feature is great, you can tighten it so it's snug on the toilet and doesn't move around when kids are getting on/off. Hook on the back is also great for easy hanging nearby. This has been a great transition from the little plastic potty on the floor and allows my 3 y/o to go potty unassisted! We loved it so much we bought another for our 2nd bathroom. We’ve also taken it with us on trips - easy because it fits any toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Hollyskye

customer_reviews.title: Great quality & toddler likes it!
customer_reviews.text: Tightening feature works really well & doesn’t budge! Is very lightweight & compact to take when toddler needs to go outside the house. Toddler seems to like the seat, uses it & seems comfortable. Very easy to clean!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with urine on it!!
customer_reviews.text: The product seems ok enough except it arrived dirty with urine dried all over the seat. I am so disgusted that I paid $35 for a used toilet seat for my child to use and that someone had the nerve to return it without cleaning it off first. These items should be checked before processing a return to ensure someone doesn’t receive an item with urine on it. Completely disgusted.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Stays in place. Doesn’t slide.
customer_reviews.text: Great for little girls. The cup in the front is low which may not be great for boys. Other versions that tried with a higher cup in the front made it tough for my 2 year old daughter to get over. This stays in place and doesn’t slide.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: The only one that truly DOESN'T slide around! Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Just trust me. Run, don't walk to buy this. We tried almost 10 potty seats, most of them cheaper than this one in hopes of getting a bargain. Not worth it. They all sucked compared to this one. We have a very standard toilet size and shape and this is the only one that can adjust tightly to the seat.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A Hubers

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Bought a few similar ones but the baby Bjorn is def worth the price. Has an easy on off spin thing to keep it from moving around. Great for tiny toddlers.
customer_reviews.author: Xc010

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: This did not work for us. It did not secure to the toilet. Newer bathroom oblong toilet seat. Pee gets trapped between the training seat and toilet seat. Would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: laurak

customer_reviews.title: Really good potty training seat
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old daughter loves this seat. She likes that theres a handle that she can pick up and put on the toilet herself. Its very comfortable and doesnt slide around.
customer_reviews.author: Sum

customer_reviews.title: Our grandson's favorite
customer_reviews.text: On the recommendation of our daughter, we got this toilet trainer to use during our toddler grandson's recent visit. It is super easy to use (easy on/off) and clean, and our grandson clearly felt secure on the potty. Didn't say I'd be saying that it an Amazon review!
customer_reviews.author: WrM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for us. 2 year old loves it.
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this seat for a couple of months now and it is very convenient and easy to use. My 2 year old can take it on and off of the toilet herself. So glad we went this route rather than the potty chairs. So nice not having to clean out a potty chair! An extra unnecessary step in my opinion. This toilet seat trainer works perfect for us.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for toilet training boys!
customer_reviews.text: Love this toilet training seat. We started using this to potty train my 2.5 year old son. The splash guard is high, and the seat is super stable! We have an elongated toilet and it fits perfectly. Price is a bit high, but so worth it!
customer_reviews.author: LoveDsign

customer_reviews.title: We have 2
customer_reviews.text: So good that we bought two. Both of our kids like the seat. It is sturdy enough that it can hold my weight (295 lbs), and once you lock it into place, the seat doesn’t slide. This is not a traveling toilet trainer, but it is light and packs easily enough in the trunk.
customer_reviews.author: KNC

customer_reviews.title: Great potty seat
customer_reviews.text: Second kid and 4th potty seat. This one's the greatest of them all. Worth the money. I love that you spin the dial to secure it, and even if it wiggles loose from being taken on/off the potty it's pretty secure.
customer_reviews.author: Chyvsh

customer_reviews.title: My kiddo will actually us it!
customer_reviews.text: We tried other potty seats, both standalone and toilet top versions. They all felt shaky and my little one did not feel stable and therefore did not want to use them. This potty training seat was recommended in a book as being adaptable to any toilet seat and it really is. The seat fits snug. The splash guard is just high enough to protect the bathroom while not getting in the way. The entire product is exceptionally easy to clean. I would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: BWiles

customer_reviews.title: Meh, it’s okay.
customer_reviews.text: This seat is better than most, but I had pretty high expectations & was kind of let down. I had anticipated better anti slip grips & a more secure fit with the ability to adjust it... however it’s still pretty loose on all 3 toilets we have in our home. It does the job, but wish it didn’t wiggle as much while potty training a 2 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Bolander

customer_reviews.title: About as good as it gets
customer_reviews.text: This is a great seat but for boys beware, it may have the guard but depending on your child’s anatomy it may not be enough. We spent about 2 weeks shouting “point it down, point it down!” until he got the hang of it!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. I tried several others and none fit in our oval toilet, this one is adjustable and fits great. Very comfortable for my son.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Best potty seat option
customer_reviews.text: My 18 month old daughter was showing interest in potty training, but the regular toilet seat terrified her. After reading lots of reviews, I decided to spend a little more for this seat. I am so glad I did. It installs quickly with just a turn of the dial underneath, and it stays amazingly secure. It has not wiggled at all even once. Thanks to the smaller hole, my daughter now has the confidence to sit on the potty and actually push my hands away. I am considering one for the grandparent's house once she is more fully into potty training.
customer_reviews.author: xstarfirex08

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit on smaller more rounded toilets.
customer_reviews.text: We got it due to all of the amazing reviews and assumed it would fit on what we thought was a normal size toilet. We rent a duplex and the bathroom is a little small for a normal home but is the usual size for any type of renting. I don't think this toilet or the last 4, from previous apartments, is any different in size and even with the adjustments this trainer will not fit. It's too oval shaped and goes right up the back of the toilet seat making it a very awkward and barely usable fit. Be careful if you think your toilet is a little small or of a more rounded than oval shape.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: For potty training kids who want to "do it all by myself!"
customer_reviews.text: Great toilet seat. Simple and easy to clean. The big, wide hook allows my 2 year old to take it on and off the potty by himself. We have one in every bathroom and hang them from Command hooks next to the toilet. It has certainly made potty training easier.
customer_reviews.author: EVSHK

customer_reviews.title: Awesome seat!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only seat that works with my Toto elongated toilet. This has an adjustment mechanism at the back so that it can fit snugly. AND if I move it to a different toilet I can readjust within seconds to fit a different style seat!!! How genius!!! My little guy used it right away with no issues. He seemed sturdy and comfy on it and his business went where it should go (no leaking, dripping, etc) This seat is perfect!!!
customer_reviews.author: MD79

customer_reviews.title: Great for elongated toilet seats!
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't say it works for elongated seats, but it does! We struggled to find a good seat for our 3 1/2-year-old to use her elongated toilet. I knew her little butt would fall into the big toilet seat, but yet she was getting way too big for her potty, and this was the perfect solution. It's very secure, comfortable, and really is ergonomic (I'm small enough that I was able to give it a try). Our daughter keeps telling us how much she loves her new seat. I gave it 4 stars because my husband noticed the splash guard seems slightly too high when she is going to sit.
customer_reviews.author: C. Reyloc

customer_reviews.title: it was great, but wanted to try different ones for the ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one initially for my son potty training, it was great, but wanted to try different ones for the other bathrooms, none compared. All bathrooms now have this one. It really has the best grip, fits all seats, and easy for them to get on and off. Plus he can easily take it on and off on his own. Five stars!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The perfect potty training seat to turn your toilet into a potty!
customer_reviews.text: The Baby Bjorn toilet trainer is the perfect seat to turn your toilet into a potty! My 11 month old daughter fits perfectly on this seat (I know... we started early) so I'm sure a 2 yr old would fit just fine as well! It's light, easy to keep clean and easy to travel with. I recommend getting a hook to hang it up next to the toilet and also get a step stool so they can get up to it themselves.
customer_reviews.author: mamadoesitbestTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I have two of them. After trying other brands to save some money ended up w this one. Best quality perfect for potty training
customer_reviews.author: Shila

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome seat! My daughter bought one for her son and it was the only seat to go on a toilet that is adjustable for all toilets and is secure so that he doesn't feel like he's going to fall in. I bought one for myself and one for his daycare. They loved it so much and wanted another for their other toilet. They couldn't afford to buy another one so I got them another one. The kids at their daycare were standing in line to use the first one I got for them. This is an excellent product and I would highly recommend it to anyone potty training. The inventor is a genius!
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Why didn’t I buy this sooner?
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using the cheap cartoon character potty seat that slides all over the toilet and my son would not go #2 for anything. It has been so frustrating. I’ve tried everything. This seat came last night. It fits so secure on the toilet. He climbed on and went #2 already this morning! He just must have been scared because the other seat was not stable. Yes, this costs more but totally worth it. I have wasted so much time and energy with the cheap seats. Lesson learned. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs E

product_meta.title: BABYBJORN Toilet Trainer - White/Black
product_meta.description:
Color:White/Black

The BabyBjörn Toilet Trainer is easy to adjust and fits firmly onto most toilet seats. Ergonomic design allows your child to sit comfortably and correctly. A FRIENDLY SEAT FOR EASY TOILET TRAINING
A child is more likely to use a big-person toilet if he or she feels comfortable doing so, and the Toilet Trainer is designed to achieve this. Making kids feel safe and at ease, the trainer's soft, ergonomic shape provides a comfortable seat without any sharp angles. However, always help your child climb on and off the toilet trainer until it is safe for the child to do it on his or her own. The contoured curves also make it easy for kids to get on and off the toilet by themselves, helping them feel independent. To encourage this independence, a perfect accompaniment to the BabyBjörn Toilet Trainer is the BabyBjörn Safe Step. Another key design feature of the Toilet Trainer is its opening, which is wide enough for parents to help kids wipe, but small enough to prevent a child from slipping through.

FITS TOILETS OF ALL SIZES
No matter how large or small the toilet is, the BabyBjörn Toilet Trainer will fit. The trainer features an adjustable dial that adapts it to toilets of all sizes. The bottom of the trainer has a soft rubber edge and adjustable wings, both of which ensure that it stays in place securely and doesn't slide under little bottoms.

MINIMIZES MESSES WITH BUILT-IN SPLASH GUARD
The BabyBjörn Toilet Trainer makes for hassle free cleaning for parents and caregivers. An integrated, angled splash guard helps prevent kids from making messes outside of the toilet. This splash proof feature translates to fewer accidents for kids, which in turn builds their confidence and makes them feel secure about using the full size toilet again and again.

CLEANS EASILY
For those family members who don't require the training seat, the Toilet Trainer has a convenient, built in handle that makes it easy to remove and replace. It is easily cleaned with hot water. Like all BabyBjörn designed products, the Toilet Trainer has a distinctive style.

QUICK FACTS ABOUT THE BABYBJÖRN TOILET TRAINER
 * Ages: 2 to 6 
 * Warranty: 2 Year Express Warranty 
 * Helps potty training kids use a full size toilet



BRAND STORY
By BabyBjorn
feature_bullets: Comfortable and secure seating; ergonomic design helps your child sit correctly
Easy for the child; When it's time to go, your child can easily put on and remove the toilet trainer on his or her own
Flexible use; The toilet trainer only needs to be adjusted once to fit your toilet seat

Easy to clean and the inward sloping splashguard prevents spills outside the toilet.Dimensions: 11.5‍ x‍ 14 x‍ 3.5 in/29‍ x‍ 36‍ x‍ 9 cm.A practical handle makes the toilet trainer easy to put away when not in use
The toilet training seat is easy to clean. Simply wipe clean or rinse under running water. Then hang it from its practical handle until it’s needed again
